page.title: 19WILDLIFE IN EPPERSTONE
page.content: About 50 species of{birds}are commomly seen.Of particular interest are the tawny owls frequently heard calling at night & the heronry on the Dover Beck.Occasionly barn owls are seen.Rarely a buzzard & sparrow hawk are seen. Of larger{animals}foxes,rabbits, hedgehogs & hares are common.Badgers live on the banks of the dumbles. Water voles live in the Dover Beck. Bats are seen in the evening in the village. Common{reptiles & anphibians}are frogs newts & toads which live in or by garden ponds.Lizzards are sometimes seen but snakes are not seen.
